2:
"Oh, that I were as I was in the past months\q when God cared for me,
\q
3:
when his lamp shined on my head,\q and when I walked through darkness by his light.


\q
4:
Oh, that I were as I was in the ripeness of my days\q when the friendship of God was on my tent,
\q
5:
when the Almighty was yet with me,\q and my children were around me,
\q
6:
when my way was covered with cream,\q and the rock poured out for me streams of oil!


\q
7:
When I went out to the city gate,\q when I sat in my place in the city square,
\q
8:
the young men saw me and kept their distance from me in respect,\q and the aged people rose and stood for me.


\q
9:
The princes used to refrain from talking when I came;\q they would lay their hand on their mouths.
\q
10:
The voices of the noblemen were hushed,\q and their tongue clung to the roof of their mouths.


\q
11:
For after their ears heard me, they would then bless me;\q after their eyes saw me, they would then give witness to me and approve of me
\q
12:
because I rescued the one who was poor when he cried out,\q and the one who had no father when he had no one to help him.
\q
13:
The blessing of him who was about to perish came on me;\q I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.


\q
14:
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me;\q my justice was like a robe and a turban.
\q
15:
I was eyes to blind people;\q I was feet to lame people.
\q
16:
I was a father to needy people;\q I would examine the case even of one whom I did not know.


\q
17:
I broke the jaws of the unrighteous man;\q I plucked the victim out from between his teeth.
\q
18:
Then I said, 'I will die in my nest;\q I will multiply my days like the grains of sand.
\q
19:
My roots are spread out to the waters,\q and dew lies all night on my branches.


\q
20:
The honor in me is always fresh,\q and the bow of my strength is always new in my hand.'
\q
21:
To me men listened; they waited for me;\q they stayed silent to hear my advice.
\q
22:
After my words were done, they did not speak again;\q my speech dropped like water on them.


\q
23:
They always waited for me as they waited for rain;\q they opened their mouth wide to drink in my words,
\q as they would do for the latter rain.
\q
24:
I smiled on them when they did not expect it;\q they did not reject the light of my face.


\q
25:
I selected their way and sat as their chief;\q I lived like a king in his army,
\q like one who comforts mourners.
